concept.title: Running commands with redirection or pipes
concept.shortdesc: When you run one-line commands that include redirection or pipes, pass bash or another shell as the command.

conbody.p: Using a shell ensures that the one-liner is run as a single command and that it works correctly with run-as. For example, instead of bolt command run "echo foo > /root/foo" --run-as root, use bolt command run "bash -c 'echo foo > /root/foo'" --run-as root.
